[Teacher]: very first album of our label Tinzee Records. What a blast from the past! I'm glad to hear that our music still has a special place in people's hearts. It's hard to believe it's been over 30 years since we

[Teacher]: to hear it all over the world and I was born with this dream. One album I remember is my debut album "The Sounds of Tinzee" which included songs like "Electro City" and "Neon Dreams". I feel so grateful
[Student]: for the band and especially to radio stations such as Google Playing Pool Rare Songs to promote their sounds using musical instruments without the lyrics and being proud of it After touring Europe in 1992 and Europe again in 1997 I became
[Teacher]: a more established artist and my fans started to grow and grow and I have to say that's the best part of the DJing career, to see your music to make people's day a little bit brighter and to know that my music is still remembered
[Student]: as an old style that Ive never heard before in my life but to be honest about my work In addition to making music on DVDs Ill also show you a new song called I Have a Feel You Never Fam
[Teacher]: iliar with it so here's a video of a live show of this song.   Please let me know what kind of music you usually listen to, and if you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember.  (Note: The message is a fictional

STARTER: Have you been on any trips recently? Where did you go, and did anything interesting happen there?
text:
[Starter]: Have you been on any trips recently? Where did you go, and did anything interesting happen there?
[Student]: Im afraid that is the worst She looked around the room for a moment in surprise and then smiled to herself as she said emphaticallyyes
[Teacher]: . I had just returned from my first trip to Europe, and I was still trying to process everything that had happened. It was my first time traveling alone, and I was excited to explore new places and experience different cultures. I had planned my trip
[Student]: into India and found something to do with this adventure which seemed like an amazing thing for me and made me happy even though it all went smoothly for some reason or other until we started back again in 1869 when I began looking forward to becoming friends
[Teacher]: with some of the people I met there. Now Im sitting in my room at home, reflecting on all that I had seen and experienced. I am looking through my old photographs and reminiscing about the places I went and the people I met. It
[Student]: s very amusing and Im fascinated by what they have done for us so much and feel quite comfortable and are interested in each other and how their lives can be improved without being able to solve them properly After thinking over more than 10 years of
[Teacher]: my life I realized that the only thing I could do was to give up on my own desires and be friends with the people who are around me and get to know them better. I started to learn more about their backgrounds and their struggles and I discovered
[Student]: that I needed someone to take care of myself so I got along really well and became good friends with others and were delighted to visit India and see what I could do for their comforts and experiences with our travels around me so quickly as I grew older
[Teacher]: and learned how to be more careful with my resources and finances and not wasting anything just to spend money and have an extra time. Its been 30 years since I returned from my trip to India and I am still thinking about that experience and the friends

[Student]: everything I could find for myself I would never forget that experience with animals has kept me in this lonely spot since leaving home to come back Her father kissed her affectionately and said No wonder MrIm happy while Harriet smiled
[Teacher]: quietly and felt a sense of peace wash over her for the first time in a long time. The scene shows how the narrator is reflecting on her childhood and how it has shaped her into the person she is today. Her nostalgia and sentimental feelings towards her

STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?

[Teacher]: . There are many different ways to celebrate a holiday, and each family may have their own unique traditions and stories. Some families may choose to celebrate with large gatherings, while others may prefer smaller, more intimate gatherings. Some families may also choose to celebrate
